content.sentence: Hi Rachel, #Thanks for your email.
I'm sorry to hear that you haven't been well.
I had flu this time last year,
so I know how you have been feeling.
I had a temperature and a headache
and had to stay in bed for a couple of days.
#Let me tell you about something much nicer!
Something, or should I say someone.
His name is Nico.
He has just joined my English class.
Yesterday, Penelope, our eccentric English teacher,
was looking everywhere for her glasses,
and she was wearing them!
I caught Nico's eye and we started giggling.
After class we went for a coffee and chatted for hours.
Oh Rachel, he's lovely - really funny and easy-going.
He's a year younger than us,
but he seems very mature and open-minded.
#Anyway I'd better go, we're meeting later.
#Love from Monica
